metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29955 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description: A transient execution vulnerability, named Floating Point Value Injection (FPVI) allowed an attacker to leak arbitrary memory addresses and may have also enabled JIT type confusion attacks. (A related vulnerability, Speculative Code Store Bypass (SCSB), did not affect Firefox.). This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.9 and Firefox < 87.

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable and has been fixed, but no release version available for it.
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
